<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module1_mcq_q66')" data-correct-answer="C"> 
  <strong style="display: block;">When calculating a company’s market capitalization, which shares are considered?</strong> 
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q66" value="A"> A. Only preferred shares</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q66" value="B"> B. All shares ever issued, including treasury shares</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q66" value="C"> C. Only outstanding shares held by investors, excluding treasury shares</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q66" value="D"> D. Only shares held by institutional investors</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_mcq_q66" value="E"> E. Only newly issued shares</label><br>
</form> 

<div id="feedback-module1_mcq_q66" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;"> 
✅ Correct: C. Market capitalization is calculated as share price × outstanding shares. Treasury shares are excluded because they are not available to investors in the market.
